terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and ensure everyone works with the latest approved versions.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, essential for compliance and regulatory inspections.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers rather than installed locally.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and share data with each other.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on, edit, and comment on the same document or project with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A security system that restricts document or system access based on a user's role within an organization, ensuring only authorized personnel can view or modify sensitive information.
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes like finance, procurement, and project management.
Internet of Things - a network of physical devices embedded with sensors and software that collect and exchange data over the internet.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory standards, industry requirements, and internal policies throughout a project lifecycle.
The process of locating and accessing specific documents or information from a documentation system or database.
A defined sequence of tasks, approvals, and processes that documents or projects must follow from creation to completion.
A centralized location where all authoritative and up-to-date information is stored, ensuring everyone accesses the same accurate data.
A detailed record that documents all modifications, updates, and revisions made to a document or system, including who made changes and when.
A pre-designed document format or structure that provides a standardized framework for creating consistent documentation across projects.
